editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: Collected out of the whole Body of the Scriptures, for the inſtructing of Youth with the Word of the Lord in the beginning, and with his Judgments and Mercies ſince the beginning, and with his dealing with his People through out many Generations, being written for our Learning, in whom the true Light hath ſhined, that they might be taught our Children, and Children's Children, throughout our Generations.
Preſented to Fathers of Families and Maſters of Schools, to train up their Children and Schollers in the Knowledg of God and the Scriptures.

q.hi: Come ye Children, and I will teach you the Fear of the Lord,

p.hi: VVHat is God, who made me and all Creatures?

sp.speaker: Maſter,
sp.p: A pure and glorious Spirit of Life and Light, John 4. 24.

p.hi: What was his Work in the Beginning?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To create Heaven and Earth, and all things therein, Gen. 1. 1.

p.hi: What was his firſt day's Work?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To create Light and Darkneſs, and to divide the Light from the Darkneſs, Gen. 1. 3, 4, 5.

p.hi: What was his ſecond day's Work?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To place the Firmament in the midſt of the Waters, to divide the Waters from the Waters, verſ. 7.

p.hi: What did he call the Firmament?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Heaven; and the gathering together
of the Waters he called the Seas, verſ. 8, 10.

p.hi: How was the Earth formed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Word of God; for he ſaid, Let the dry Land appear, and it was ſo, verſ. 9.

p.hi: How came the Earth to bring forth Fruit?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Command of God; for he ſaid, Let the Earth bring forth Graſs, and the Herb yielding Seed after his kind, and the Fruit Tree yielding Fruits after his kind, and it was ſo, verſ. 11.

p.hi: What was his third day's Work?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To place the Earth and Seas in their proper places, that they might be fruitful, verſ. 12.

p.hi: What was his fourth day's Work?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To place two great Lights in the Firmament, to give light upon the Earth; and to divide the Day from the Night, verſ. 15, 16.

p.hi: Which of th • ſe Lights was to rule the Day, and which the Night?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The greater Light was to rule the Day, and the leſſer to rule the Night, verſ. 16.

p.hi: What was his fifth day's Work?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
To repleniſh the Earth with all living Creatures, and Fowls to fly above the
Earth in the open Firmament of Heaven, verſ. 20, 21.

p.hi: How came they to be Fruitful, and to encreaſe in the Earth and Seas?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Word of God, who ſaid to the Creatures he had made, Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the Waters in the Seas, and let the • owl multiply in the Earth, verſ. 22.

p.hi: What was his ſixth day's Work?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To create Man in his own Image, and to give him Dominion over all other Creatures which he had made in the Earth and Seas, verſ. 26.

p.hi: Of what was Man created?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of the Duſt of the Ground; and God breathed into his Noſtrils the Breath of Life, ſo that he became a Living Soul, Gen. 2. 7.

p.hi: Where did God place Man in the Begining?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the Garden of Eden, where he cauſed to grow every Tree that was pleaſant to the ſight, and good for Food; the Tree of Life he alſo placed in the midſt of the Garden, and the Tree of Knowlege of Good and Evil, verſ. 9.

p.hi: What was Man's Work in the Garden?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To dreſs it and keep it, verſ. 15.

p.hi: What was Man's Food in the Garden?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Fruit of every Tree of the Garden, except the Fruit of the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil, verſ. 16.

p.hi: In what State was Man placed in the Garden?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In Innocency, not knowing Evil, having liberty to feed of the Tree of Life, and was bleſſed of God in all the Works of his hands.

p.hi: Who gave Names to all Creatures which God had made?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Adam; and whatſoever he called every Creature, that was the Name thereof, verſ. 19, 20.

p.hi: How was Woman created?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of a Rib which the Lord took out of Man; and ſhe was called Woman, becauſe ſhe was taken out of Man, Gen. 2. 21, 22, 23.

p.hi: How came Man to loſe that glorious State in which he was created?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By eating of the Fruit of the Tree of Knowledg, which God had forbidden, Gen. 3. 17, to the end.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Whither was Adam drove for his Diſobedience?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Into the Earth, which was curſed for his ſake, verſ. 17.

sp.speaker: S,
sp.p: Who was Adam's firſt Son, after he was driven into the Earth?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Cain; who was a Tiller of the Ground Gen. 4. 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was Adam's ſecond Son?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Abel; who was a Keeper of Sheep, Gen. 4 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why did Cain ſlay Abel his Brother?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe God had more Reſpect to Abel and to his Offering, then to Cain, Gen. 4, 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Cain's Lot after he had ſlain Abel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Curſe from God; being made a Fugative and a Vagabond in the Earth, Gen. 4. 11, 12.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did Adam live upon the Earth?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Nine Hundred and thirty Years, Gen. 5. 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did Seth live?

sp.speaker: M,
sp.p: Nine hundred and twelve years, Gen. 5. 8.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did Enos live?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Nine hundred and five years, Gen. 5. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did Enoch live?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Three hundred ſixty and five years, Gen. 5. 22.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did Mathuſalah live?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Nine hundred ſixty and nine years, Gen 5. 27.

p.hi: What provoked God to deſtroy the old World?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Wickedneſs thereof, Gen. 6. 5 6, 7.

p.hi: By what did God deſtroy the old World?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By a • lood of Water, Gen. 6. 17.

p.hi: Who was ſaved from the Flood?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Noah, and his Houſhold, and all that was with him in the Ark, Gen. 7. 23.

p.hi: How long was the Water upon the Earth?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: An hundred and fifty dayes, Gen. 7. 24.

p.hi: By whom did God plant the Earth after the Flood?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Noah, and his Sons, whom he had bleſſed, Gen. 9. 1, 2.

p.hi: W •• t is the Token that God will no more deſtroy •• e Earth by Water?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: His Bow, which appeareth in the Clouds of Heaven, Gen. 9. 13, 14, 15.

p.hi: Ʋnto whom was the Promiſe of Chriſt to come confirmed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto Abraham, and his Seed, which are true Believers, Gen. 12. 1, 2, 3. Gal. 3. 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Ʋnto whom was the Promiſe of the Land of Canaan?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto Abraham and his Seed, Gen. 12. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How was Abraham juſtified?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Faith in the Promiſe of God, Gen. 15. 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Token of God's Covenant to Abraham and his Seed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Circumciſion in the Fleſh of their Foreskin, Gen. 17. 10, 11.

p.hi: With whom was God's everlaſting Covenant eſtabliſhed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: With Iſaac, and his Seed after him, Gen. 17. 18, 19.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Sodom and Gomorrah deſtroyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe their ſin was very grievous, Gen. 19. 20.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Abraham's ſuit to God to ſpare Sodom?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For the ſake of the Righteous that was in it, Gen. 26. to the end.

p.hi: Who was found Righteous in the Cities?

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
With what was Sodom and Gomorrah
•• ſtroyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: With Fire and Brimſtone from Heaven, Gen. 19. 24.

p.hi: Who were delivered out of the midſt of the Overthrow?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Lot, his Wife, and two Daughters, verſ. 29.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Whither did Lot go?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Zoar, verſ. 30.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Lot's Wife made a Pillar of Salt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe ſhe diſobeyed the Word of the Lord, in looking behind her, Gen. 19. verſ. 26.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: what Sacrifice did God require of Abraham?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: His only Son Iſaac, Gen. 22. 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Abraham bleſſed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe he believed and obeyed God. which was particularly ſhewed in offering his only Son at the Command of God, Gen. 22. 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How old was Sarah when ſhe dyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: An hundred and twenty years, Gen. 23. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How old was Abraham when he dyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: An hundred threeſcore and fifteen years, Gen. 25. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was Abraham's Son?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Iſaac, of whom came Jacob and Eſau, Gen. 25. 24, 25.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How many Sons had Jacob?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Twelve; Ruben, Simeon and Levi, Judah, Iſachar and Zebulun, Joſeph and Benjamin, Dan and Napthali, Gad and Aſher, Gen. 35. 22, 23, 24, 25.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Joſeph hated of his Brethren?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe of the Dream which he dreamed, Gen, 37. 5, 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Joſeph's Dream?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That his Brethren's Sheaves did obeyſance to his Sheaf, verſ. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How came Joſeph into Egypt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He was ſold thither by his Brethren for Twenty Pieces of Silver, Gen. 37. 28.

p.hi: What was God's End in ſuffering his Brethren to ſell him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To preſerve the Lives of many, Gen. 45. 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: To whom was Joſeph ſold?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Potipher, an Officer of Pharoah King of Egypt.

p.hi: How did God try his Heart there?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Temptations of Potipher's Wife, which he with-ſtood, Gen. 39. 7, 8, 9, 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why did Potipher caſt him into Priſon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe his Wife accuſed him falſly, Gen. 39. 17.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How came Joſeph out of Priſon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Pharoah's chief Butler, Gen. 41. 14.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How came he to be advanced in Pharoahs Houſe in Egypt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By interpreting Pharaoh's Dream, Gen. 41. 38, 39. 40.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Pharoah's Dream?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That he ſtood by the Bank of a River, and there came ſeven fat Kine out of the River, and after them ſeven lean Kine, and the ſeven lean Kine devoured the ſeven fat Kine, &c. Gen. 41. 17, 18, 19, 20, 21.

p.hi: What was ſignified by the ſeven fat Kine?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Seven years of great Plenty throughout all the Land of Egypt, verſ. 29.

p.hi: What was ſignified by the ſeven lean Kine?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Seven years of great Famine, ſo that all the Plenty ſhould be forgotten, verſ. 30.

p.hi: Did theſe things come to paſs?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, ſo that Joſeph having gathered Corn in all the Land of Egypt, ſaved many in the Famine, verſ. 55, 56.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How came Joſeph's Brethren to bow to him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
They came down to Egypt to buy Corn of him, unto whom they often bowed,
not knowing it was their Brother, Gen. 42. 6, 8.

p.hi: How came he to be made known unto them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He diſcovered himſelf, and ſent for his Father into Egypt, and nouriſhed him and his Brethren there five years of Famine, Gen. 46. & 47. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Name of the ſecond King over Egypt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Pharaoh, Exod. 1. 8.

p.hi: How did he Rule?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In great Rigour over the Children of Iſrael, verſ. 13.

p.hi: How did God deliver Iſrael out of his Hand?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By a ſtrong Hand, and a mighty Power, Ex. 14. 30.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How was Pharaoh deſtroyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He was drowned in the Red-Sea, Ex. 14. 27, 28.

p.hi: How did the Children of Iſrael eſcape through the Red-Sea?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Lord made the Sea a Wall to them on the Right-hand and on the Left, ſo that they walked on Dry Land in the midſt of the ſea, verſ. 21, 22.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
Whither did God bring Iſrael when he de
• ivered them out of the Land of Egypt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Into the Wilderneſs of Sin, Exod. 16. 1, 2.

p.hi: With what did God feed Iſrael in the Wilderneſs?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: With Bread from Heaven, verſ. 4.

p.hi: What was the Sabboth God gave Iſrael in the Wilderneſs?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Seventh Day, verſ. 22, 23.

p.hi: Was Iſrael content with the Bread from Heaven?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; they murmured for want of Water, Ex. 17. 2, 3.

p.hi: From whence had they VVater?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Out of the Rock Horib, Ex. 17. 6.

p.hi: What was God's Law to Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Ten Commandments, &c. Ex. 20.

p.hi: Did Iſrael keep the Law and Commandments of God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; for they made a Golden Calf, and worſhipped it, Ex. 32. 1, 2.

p.hi: What became of the Calf that Iſrael had made?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Moſes burnt it in the Fire, and ground it to Powder, verſ. 20.

p.hi: Whither did God lead Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Towards the Land of Canaan, their Inheritance, Numb. 34. 2.

p.hi: In what did Iſrael's Bleſſedneſs conſiſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
In hearkening diligently to the Voice of the Lord their God, and in ob
• erving all his Commandments, Deut. 28. • , 2.

p.hi: In what did their miſery ſtand?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In diſobeying the Voice and Commands of God, verſ. 15.

p.hi: What was God's Purpoſe in giving Iſrael his Law?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they might learn to obſerve the Lord their God, and obſerve and do all the words of the Law, Deut. 31. 12.

p.hi:
By whom did God give his Law to Iſ
• ael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Hand of Moſes his Servant, verſ. 9.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How old was Moſes when he dyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: An hundred and twenty years, yet his Eyes were not dim, nor his Natural Force abaced, Deut. 34. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Whom did God chuſe to Rule over Iſrael after the Death of Moſes?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Joſhua the Son of Nun, Joſhua 1. 1, 2, 3.

p.hi: How long walked Iſrael in the Wilderneſs?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Forty years, till all the men of War were conſumed, becauſe they obeyed not the Voice of the Lord, Joſh. 5. 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Iſrael ſmitten by their Enemies?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe they took of the accurſed Thing, which God had forbidden, Joſh. 7. 1, 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did God manifeſt his Power and Preſence with Joſhua, in the behalf of Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In giving him many ſignal Victories over his Enemies. Joſh. 6. 20, 21, 22.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How was God's Anger turned away from Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By putting from amongſt them the accurſed thing, which God had forbidden, Joſh. 7. 24, 25, 26.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the moſt ſignal Token God ſhewed Joſhua in the purſuit of his Enemies?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In that he cauſed the Sun and Moon to ſtand ſtill about a whole day at the requeſt of Joſhua, till the People were avenged of their Enemies, Joſh. 10. 12, 13, 14.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How old was Joſhua when he dyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: An hundred and ten years old, Joſh. 23. 29.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did Iſrael keep the Commandments of the Lord after the Death of Joſhua?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; they did Evil in the Sight of the Lord, and ſerv'd Baalim▪ therefore they could no longer ſtand before their Enemies, Judg. 2. 11, 12, 13, 14.

p.hi: How was Iſrael recovered?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By putting away Baalim, and ſerving the Lord only, 1 Sam. 2 3, 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did God for Iſrael when they ſerved▪ him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Deſtroy the Philiſtines their Enemies, 1 Sam. 7. 11, 12, 13, 14

sp.speaker: S
sp.p: How did Iſrael further provoke the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In asking them a King, 1 Sam. 8. 6.

p.hi: To what end did they ask a King?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe the Lord ſhould not raign over the 〈◊〉 1 Sam. 8. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the name of the King which Iſrael choſe?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Saul, 1 Sam. 9. 17.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: By whom was Saul anointed King?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Samuel, 1 Sam. 10. 1, 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Saul rejected of God from being King over Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe he kept not God's Commandment, 1 Sam. 13. 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who did God chuſe to Rule Iſrael after Saul?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: David; being a Man after his own Heart, verſ. 14.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who anointed David King over Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Samuel, 1 Sam. 16. 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
How did God manifeſt his Power 〈◊〉
David?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In ſlaying Goliah of the Philiſtines without Sword or Spear, 1 Sam. 17. 37, 38, 39.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: With what did David overcome and ſlay Goliah of the Philiſtines?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: With a Sling, and one of the ſmooth Stones taken out of a Brook; and cut off his Head with his own Sword, 1 Sam, 17. 40, 49.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did God deliver Saul to David?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In a Cave in the Wilderneſs of Engedi, 1 Sam. 34. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did David kill him in the Cave?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; he had Mercy on him, and only cut off the Lap of his Garment, verſ. 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Of whom did Saul ask Counſel after God was departed from him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of a Witch, 1 Sam 28. 8.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did Saul dye?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By his own Sword, with his three Sons, 1 Sam. 31. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did David Raign over Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Forty years and ſix Moneths, 2 Sam. 5. 4, 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: In what did David ſin againſt God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
In Committing Adultery with Bathſheba the Wife of Ʋriah the Hittite, 2 Sam.
• 1. 4.

sp.speaker: S▪
sp.p: Who did God ſend to ſhew David his ſin?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Nathan the Prophet, under the Pa
• able of the Ewe Lamb, 2 Sam 12.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What became of the Child Bathſheba bare unto David in Adultry?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: God ſtruck it that it dyed, 2 Sam. 12. 18.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How came David to be reconciled to God again?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Repentance and great Judgment, verſ. 13.

p.hi: What did he offer unto the Lord, who reſtored him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: A Song of Praiſe, 2 Sam. 22. whole Chapter.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was anointed King over Iſrael after David?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Solomon, 1 Kings 1. 39.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did he ask of God to rule Iſrael withal?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Neither Riches nor Honour, but an Underſtanding Heart to do Juſtice and Judgment, 1 Kings 3. 9, 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did God anſwer Solomon's Deſire?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In giving him Wiſdom and Underſtanding exceeding much, and a large Heart, even as the Sand on the Sea-Shore, 1 Kings 4. 29, 30, 31.

p.hi: Whom did God appoint to build a Houſe for his Name.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Solomon, 1 Kings 5. 5, 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Where was the Houſe which Solomon built for the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: At Jeruſalem, 1 Kings 7. 1, 2.

p.hi: Did God promiſe his Preſence therein?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, to put his Name there forever, 1 Kings 9. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Was the Heart of Solomon perfect with the Lord, as was David his Father?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No, he loved the Daughters of Moab, Amon and Edom, which the Lord had commanded Iſrael, They ſhould not go in to them, nor ſuffer them to come to them, leſt they turned their Hearts after their Godds, 1 Kings 11. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did Solomon's Wives turn his Heart after their Godds?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, ſo that he wrought wickedneſs in the ſight of the Lord, verſ. 4, 5 6.

p.hi: How did God manifeſt his diſpleaſure for ſo doing?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In threatning to rent the Kingdom from Solomon, and to give it to his Servant, verſ. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did God ſpare Solomon in his Day?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, for David his Servant's ſake; but he rent the Kingdom of Iſrael out o • his Sons Hand, verſ. 12.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
Did God rent all the Kingdom of Iſrael
• ut of the Hand of Solomon's Son?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; he left him one Tribe for David's ſake, and for Jeruſalem's ſake, verſ. 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Ʋnto whom did God give the ten Tribes of Iſrael after Solomon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto Jeroboam his Servant, 1 Kings 11, 31.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did Jeroboam ſin againſt God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In making two Calves of Gold, ſetting one in Bethel, and the other in Dan. and cauſing Iſrael to worſhip them, 1 Kings 12. 28.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who raigned over Judah after Rehoboam?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Abijam his Son, 1 Kings 15. 1.

p.hi: How was he rejected of God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe he walked in the ſins of his Father, verſ. 3.

p.hi: Who Raigned after him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Aſa, verſ. 9.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did Aſa walk before God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He did right in the ſight of the Lord, as did David his Father, verſ. 11.

p.hi: How did he pleaſe God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In putting all the S • domites out of the Land, and putting away the Idols of his Father, verſ. 12, 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did Aſa raign in Jeruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Forty and one Years, 1 Kings 15. 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who Raigned over Iſrael after Aſa?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Baaſha the Son of Ahijah, 1 Kings 15. 33.

p.hi: How long did he Raign?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Twenty four years, verſ. 33.

p.hi: How did he provoke the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In walking in the way of Jeroboam his Father, who made Iſrael to ſin, 1 Kings 16. 2, 3.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who Raigned after Baaſha over Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Elah his Son, verſ. 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did Elah Raign?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Two years, verſ. 8.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who Raigned after Elah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Zimri; who ſlew all the Houſe of Baaſha, not leaving thereof one to piſs againſt the Wall, according to the Word of the Lord by Jehu the Prophet, 1 Kings 16. 11, 12, 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who Raigned after Zimri?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Omri, Captain of the Hoſt, 1 Kings 16. 16.

p.hi: How did he walk before God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He did Evil in the ſight of the Lord, yea, worſe then all that were before him, walking in the ways of Jeroboam, ver. 25, 26.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who raigned over Iſrael after Omri?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Ahab his Son, 1 Kings 16. 28.

p.hi: How long did he Raign?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Two and twenty years, verſ. 29.

p.hi: How did he walk before the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He did worſe in the ſight of God then all that was before him, verſ. 30.

p.hi: What were his Sins?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He walked in the way of Jeroboam the Son of Nebat, who provoked the Lord with their ſins.
Alſo, he took Jezabel the Daughter of Et baal King of Zidonians to Wife.
Alſo, he reared up an Alter to Baal in the Houſe of Baal, which he built in Samaria.
And he made a Grove, and provoked the Lord God of Iſrael more then all the Kings of Iſrael, which were before him▪ verſ. 30, 31, 32, 33.
Furthermore, he coveted Naboth's Vineyard, and Jezabel his Wife cauſed Naboth to be ſlain for his Vineyard, 1 Kings 21. 11, 12, 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How was God's Diſpleaſure manifeſted againſt Ahab?

sp.speaker: M,
sp.p:
By Elijah the Prophet, who told him by the Word of the Lord, That in the
ſame place where Dogs licked up the blood of Naboth, ſhould Dogs lick up even his Blood alſo, 1 Kings 21. 19, 20.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What became of lezabel his wife.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Lord ſp • ke ſaying, The Dogs ſhall eat Jezabel by the Wall of Jezreel, verſe 23.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did Ahab behave himſelf when the Word of the Lord came againſt him by the Prophet Elijah.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He rent his Clothes, and put Sackcloth upon him, and Faſted, and lay in Sackcloth, and went ſoftly; and therefore the Lord ſaid, Becauſe Ahab humbled himſelf, that he would not bring that evil upon his Houſe in his dayes, but in his Sons days would he bring evil upon his Houſe, 1 Kin. 21. 27, 28, 29.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Of whom did Ahab ask counſel, whether he ſhould go to Battel againſt Rampth Gilead, or not?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of four hundred falſe Prophets, who ſaid, Go up, and the Lord ſhall deliver it into thy hand, 1 Kings 22. 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What ſaid the Lord unto him by the mouth of Micaiah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That God had appointed Evil againſt Ahab, and that he ſhould not return from the Battel in Peace, 1 Kings 22. 23, 24.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What became of Micaiah for this Saying?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Ahab commanded to put him in the Priſon Houſe till he returned, and feed him with Bread & Water of Affliction, verſ. 27.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did Ahab return in Peace?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; he was ſlain in the Battle at Raemoth-Gilead, and the Doggs licked his Blood, according to the Word of the Lord, 1 Kings 21. 19. and 22. 25.

p.hi: Who raigned after him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Jehoſhaphat the Son of Aſa, verſ. 41.

p.hi: Who raigned after him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Ahaziah the Son of Ahab, verſ. 51.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did Ahaziah walk with God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
He did Evil in his ſight, and walked in the way of his Father, and in the way of Jeroboam the Son or Nebat, in worſhip
• ng of Baal, 1 Kings 22. 52, 53.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Of whom did Ahaziah in his Sickneſs ask whether he ſhould live or dye?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of Baalzebub the Godd of Ekron, Kings 1. 2.

p.hi: Who reproved him for it?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: God by Elijah the Prophet, ver. 3, 4.

p.hi: Of whom ought he to have enquired?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of the God of Iſrael, verſ. 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did the King of Samaria dye at that time?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, 2 Kings 1. 17.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What became of Elijah the Prophet?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He was taken up into Heaven with a Whilewind, 2 Kings 2. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: By whom did God ſpeak to Iſrael after Elijah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Eliſha, verſ. 15.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did God manifeſt his Power with Eliſha?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In dividing the Waters of Jordan, and healing them, 2 Kings 2. 14, 21, 22.
2dly, In increaſing the Oyl in the Widdow's Pitcher, 2 Kings 4. 5, 6.
3dly, In raiſing the Shunamite's Son to Life, verſ. 35.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who anointed Jehu King over Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: One of the Children of the Prophets at the Command of Eliſha.

p.hi: What did God require of him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To ſlay the whole Houſe of Ahab according to the Word of the Lord, 1 King 21. 15.

p.hi: Did he fulfil the Word of the Lord here in?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Yea, he ſmote Jehoram through hi • Heart, and utterly deſtroyed Jezabel, an • the ſeventy Sons of Ahab, 2 Kings 9. 2 • 33, 34, 35. and chap. 10. 6, 7. and a • that remained of the Houſe of Ahab i •
Samaria, according to the Word of the Lord, verſ. 17.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did Jehu walk before God with a perfect Heart?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; for he departed not from the ſins of Jeroboam, verſ. 31.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did God's Love continue ſtill to Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, till they fell into Idolatry, and then he loathed them, and ſent Lyons amongſt them, which devour'd them, 2 King. 17. 22, 23, 24, 25.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Iſrael's Idolatry?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Their Idols and Images, which every Nation ſerved, and made, and put them in their High Places, 2 Kings 17. 29, 32, 41.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who broke down Iſrael's Images and Groves?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Hezekiah King of Judah, 2 Kings
• 8. 4.

p.hi: How did he walk before God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In Truth with a perfect Heart, 2 King. 20. 3.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: To whom did Hezekiah call for help when • e was ſick?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Unto the Lord with Tears, 2 Kings
• 0. 3.

p.hi: How did the Lord anſwer him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In adding to his dayes fifteen years, verſ. 6.

p.hi: What was the Sign God gave him that he would heal him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In bringing the Shaddow Ten Degrees backward upon the Dial of Ahaz, 2 Kings 20. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was King of India?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: A • aſhuerus, Eſther 1. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who contrived the Deſtruction of Iſrael in his day?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Hamon, Eſth. 3. 8, 9.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why did Hamon ſeek to Deſtroy the Jews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe Mordecai, whoſe People they were, would not riſe up before him, no • bow to him, Eſt. 3. 3, 4, 5, 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How was Mordecai and the Jews Delivered?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: At the Requeſt of Queen Eſther, Eſth▪ 7. 3, 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
What became of Hamon, who contrived the Deſtruction of Mordecai and th •
Jews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He was Hanged by the Kings Commandment on the Gallows he had prepare • for Mordecai, verſ. 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
What became of the Jews Enemies
•
• ll the Provinces of A • aſhuerus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They were all deſtroyed at the Kings Commandment, with Hamon's Ten Sons, Eſth. 9. 25.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: In what Land did Job dwell?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the Land of Ʋz, Job 1. • .

p.hi: How did he walk before God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: With a Perfect and Upright Heart, • earing God, and eſchewing Evil, verſ. 2.

p.hi: How did God try his Heart?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: With the Loſs of all his Sons and Daughters, and outward Subſtance, which was great, verſ. 15, 16, 17, 18.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did Job murmur againſt God, when he ſuffered him to be ſtript of all?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No, he did not ſin, nor charge God fooliſhly; but ſaid, The Lord giveth, and the Lord taketh away, bleſſed be the Name of the Lord, verſ. 22.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did God further try Job's Integrity?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: in ſuffering Satan to ſmite his Body from the Crown of his Head to the Sole of his Foot, Job 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did not Job continue his Integrity to the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yes; neither hitherto did he ſin with his Lips, verſ. 3, 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How far did the Lord ſuffer Satan to try Job?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In all that he had, except his Life Job 2. 6.

p.hi: Could all his Friends and Acquaintanc • move him from his Integrity?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; though his Wife and Acquaintance tempted him on every ſide, Job 2. 3 9, 10, 11, 12.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did God ever reſtore Job unto his former Subſtance again?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, in greater abundance then when he firſt ſmote him, Job 42. 12, 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did Job live after God reſtored him to Proſperity in his Subſtance?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Till he ſaw his Sons, and Sons Sons even four Generations, verſ. 16.

p.hi: Who wrote the Book of the Pſalms?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Chiefly David, Pſal. 1, 2, 3, 4.

p.hi: What is the Sabſtance of that whol • Book?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: A Teſtimony of the Prayers, Tears Sufferings and Joys of David.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who writ the Book of the Proverbs?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Solomon.

p.hi: What is the ſubſtance of that Book?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Expreſſions of Wiſdom ſet forth by Solomon in many true Proverbs and wi •• Sayings.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who wrote the Book of Eccleſiaſtes?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Solomon the Preacher.

p.hi: What is the ſubſtance of that Book?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: It ſetteth forth the Vanity of all • hings below the Sun, Eccl. 1. 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What is the ſubſtance of Solomon's Song?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Such familiar Diſcourſe of Love as in the beſt ſenſe may import myſtical Communication of the pure and ſpiritual Love between Chriſt and his Church, Eccl. cap. 1, &c.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who writ the Book of Iſaiah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: It was the Viſion of Iſaiah the Son of Amoz, which he ſaw concerning the Rebellion and Diſobedience of Judah and Jeruſalem in the dayes of the ſeveral Kings thereof, Iſa. 1.

p.hi: What was their Diſobedience and Rebellion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Their Princes were Companions of Thieves, whoſe hands were full of Blood; they judged not the Cauſe of the Fatherleſs, nor the Cauſe of the Widdow; but every one loved Gifts, and followed after Rewards, verſ. 15, 16, 23, 24.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Iſaiah further ſee concerning the Jews Rebellion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they ſhould be as an Oak whoſe Leaf faded, and as a Garden that had no Water, and the ſtrong ſhould be as Tow, and the Maker thereof as a Spark, and they ſhould both burn together, and none ſhould quench them, Iſa. 1. 30, 31.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What People or Nation did God call after the Jews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Gentiles, Iſa. chap. 2.

p.hi: Who did God pr • miſe to be their Light • nd Leader?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Chriſt, the Prince of Peace, verſ. 4.

p.hi: What was God's promiſe in him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That in the laſt days the Mountain of the Lord's Houſe ſhould be eſtabliſhed on the top of the Mountains; and many People ſhould ſay, Come, let us walk up to the Mountain of the Lord, to the Houſe of the God of Jacob, and he will teach us of his Wayes, &c. Iſa. 2. 3.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Iſaiah's Viſion concerning Wars after Chriſt's Coming?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they ſhould beat their Swords into Mattocks, and their Spears into Sythes, and Nation ſhall no more lift up a Sword againſt Nation, neither ſhould learn War any more.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did Iſaiah ſet forth the State of Judah and Jeruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Under the ſimilitude of a Vineyard, which was hedged about, and planted with choyce Plants, and p • a • ed in a very fruitful Hill, from which the Planter expected Grapes, but it brought forth wild Grapes, Iſa. 5. 2.

p.hi: What was the Sentence given againſt this •• uitleſs Vineyard?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To take away the Hedge thereof, that it may be eaten up; and break down the Wall thereof, that it may be trodden down; and to lay it waſte, &c. Iſa. 5. verſ. 5, 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who did God promiſe to the Remnant of Judah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Chriſt, the Immanuel, Iſa. 7. 14.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did God promiſe to the Gentiles?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they who walked in Darkneſs had ſeen great Light, and they who dwelt in the Land of the ſhaddow of Death upon them had the Light ſhined, Iſa 9. 3.

p.hi: Of whom did Chriſt ſpring?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Out of the Stem of Jeſſe, Iſa. 11. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Iſaiah's Viſion concerning Babylon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That it ſhould be deſtroyed by the Meeds and Perſians, Iſa. 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: D • d God return the Captivity of Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, and made them reſt in their own Land; and ſaid, they ſhould take them Priſoners whoſe Captives they were, Iſa. 14. 1, 2 3.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Iſaiah ſee concerning Moab?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Its Deſtruction, becauſe of its Pride and Arrogancy, Iſa. 16. 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Propheſied concerning Damaſcus and Ephraim?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Their Deſtruction and Overthrow, Iſa. 17. 1, 2, 3.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Iſaiah's Sign in going Naked three Years?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The three years Captivity of Egypt and Ethiopia, Iſa. 20.

p.hi: What was promiſed by Chriſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Remiſſion of Sins, Iſa. 40. 1, 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: When was the Coming of John Baptiſt ſeen?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the days of Iſaiah. verſ. 3.

p.hi: What was his Work?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To prepare the Way of the Lord, v. 3.

p.hi: Why was Chriſt ſent a Light into the World?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
For a Covenant to the people, and
for a Light to the Gentiles, to open the Eyes of the Blind, and to bring the • riſoners out of the Priſon-Houſe, and them that ſit in Darkneſs out of the region of the ſhaddow of Death, Iſa. 42 6, 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Iſaiah ſee concerning Babylon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Deſtruction thereof, and of their Idols, Iſa. 47.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was God's Promiſe to the Gentile • ?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That more of them ſhould believe the Goſpel, then the Jews, Iſa. 54. 1, 2.

p.hi: What was God's Invitation to the Thirſty under the Goſpel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To come to the Water of Life and drink freely, without Money and without Price, Iſa. 55. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Wherefore did he reprove the Jews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For ſpending their Money for that which was not bread, and their Labour for that which did not ſatisfie, verſ. 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did he ſee concerning the Watchmen of Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M
sp.p:
That they were all blind, and had no knowledge, and that they were dumb and greedy Dogs, that could never have enough every one lo • king for their own wa •
▪ & for his Gain from his Quarter. Iſa 56. 10, 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: To what did Iſaiah compare the Wicked?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To the raging Sea, whoſe Waters caſt up Mire and Dirt, Iſa. 57. 20.

p.hi: What was the Hypocrites Faſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To afflict his Soul for a day, and to hang down his head as a Bulruſh, Iſ. 58. 4▪ 5.

p.hi: What was the Faſt of the Faithful?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To looſe the hands of Wickedneſs, to take off the heavy Burdens, and to let the Oppreſſed go free, verſ. 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What is the chief Subſtance of the Book of Iſaiah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: An Evangeligal Propheſie of the Coming, Work, and Power of Chriſt, with God's Univerſal Love in Chriſt to all Mankind?

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: When came the Word of the Lord to Jeremiah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the dayes of Joſiah King of Judah, Jer. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the firſt Sign God ſhewed Jeremiah of the Deſtruction of Judah and Jeruſaſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
The Rod of an Almon Tree its early budding, ſhewing that God would ha
• ten to perform his Word, verſ. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the next Sign given Jeremiah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
A Seething-Pot out of the North, thorough which God declared to them his
Judgments, for all the Wickedneſs of them that forſook him, & burnt Incenſe to other Godds, and worſhipped the Works of their own hands, verſ. 13, 14, 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Jeruſalem deſtroyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe they forſook the Lord, the Fountain of living Waters, and digged to th • mſelves broken Ciſterns, that would hold no Water, Jer. 2. 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did God ſet forth Iſrael's Reblelion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: As a Woman that Rebelleth againſt her Husband, ſo did the whole Houſe of Iſrael Rebel againſt God, Jer. 3. 20.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What Circumciſion more then the outward did the Lord require of the Men of Judah and Jeruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Circumciſion of the Heart▪ Jer. 4. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Egypt, Judah, Edom, and the Children of Amon threatned by the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe they were not Circumciſed in Heart, Jer. 9. 26.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What Figure did God give Jeremiah of the Deſtruction of the Jews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: A Linnen Girdle, which God cauſe • him to hide in the Clift of the Rock Perath, Jer. 13. 4, 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What were the Plagues with which God would deſtroy the Jews?

sp.speaker: M
sp.p:
Four; the Sword to ſlay, the Dogs t •
•• ar, the Fowl • s of the Heaven and the Beaſts of the Earth to devour, Jer. 15 3.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: By whom did God then declare his Will and Mind to t • e Jews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Jeremiah, for which the Jews conſpir'd Miſchief againſt him, Jer. 18. 18.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who ſmote Jeremiah, and put him in the Stocks, for ſpeak • ng the Word of the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paſhur the Son of Immer the Prieſt, Jer. 20. 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Jeremiah teſtifie concerning the falſe Paſtors of Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M
sp.p: He cry'd Wo unto them who deſtroyed and ſcatt • red the Sheep of the Lord's Paſture, Jer. 23. 1, 2.
He cry'd alſo againſt the Prophets of Samaria, that propheſi • d in Baal, and cauſed the people to err, verſ. 13.

He alſo cryed againſt the Prophets of Jeruſalem, who committed Adultery, and w • lked in Lyes, and ſtrengthened the hands of Evil-doers, ſo that none could turn from his Wickedneſs; that they were all as Sodom, and as the Inhabitants of Gomorrah, verſ. 14.

p.hi: whom did the Lord promiſe to ſet over his flock?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Chriſt the true Shepherd, Jer. 23 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Cauſe the falſe Prophets of Iſrael did not profit the people?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe they ſtood not in the Counſel of God themſelves, therefore was not the Word of the Lord with them, neither did they profit the people at all, verſ. 23.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did God threaten to bring upon Judah and Jeruſalem for their continued Rebellion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they ſhould be in Captivity under the King of Babylon Seventy Years, Jer. 25. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did the falſe Prophets of Iſrael deal with Jeremy for ſpeaking the Word of the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They judged him worthy of Death, Jer. 26. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did God command Jeremiah to ſend unto the King of Judah, and the other Kings near him, to premoniſh them of their Captivity under Nebuchadnezar?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Bonds and Yoaks, Jer. 27. 1, 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: When was Judah and Jeruſalem brought into Captivity under the King of Babel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the Beginning of the Raign of Jehoiakim the Son of Joſiah King of Judah, Jer. 26. 1.

p.hi: When did God promiſe their Return?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: After Seventy Years, Jer. 29. 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Promiſe of God to Iſrael after their Return?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: His Everlaſting Love and Mercy to them, in making a New Covenant with them. Jer. 31. 31.

p.hi: What was that New Covenant?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To write his Law in their Hearts, and place his Fear in their inward parts, that they ſhould no more teach every man his Brother, &c. verſ. 33, 34.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did God further promiſe Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That he would give them one Heart and one Way, Jer. 32. 39.
Alſo, That he would cauſe the Branch of Righteouſneſs to ſpring up unto David, who ſhould execute Judgment and Righteouſneſs in the Land, Jer. 33. 15.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was King in Judah when the King of Babylon came to deſtroy Ieruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Zedekiah, Jer. 34. 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Ieremiah put into the Stocks, and into the miery Dungeon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For ſpeaking the word of the Lord concerning the Deſtruction of Jeruſalem? Jer. 38. 4, 5, 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How was Ieremiah deliverod out of the Dungeon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
By the interceſſion of Ebed-Mele • h,
the Black-moor to the King, Jer. 38. 9, 10, 11, 12, 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Where did Ieremiah remain then?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the Court of the Priſon, Jer. 38. 28.

p.hi: How long continued he there?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Till Jeruſalem was taken by the King of Babel, verſ. 11, 12, 13, 14.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who freed Ieremiah out of Priſon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Nebuzaraden, the chief Steward of the King of Babylon, Jer. 40. 1, 2, 3, 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What became of the Iews that were in Egypt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They were deſtroyed by the Word of the Lord 〈◊〉 their Idolatry there, Jer. 46. 9, 10, 11 〈◊〉

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
What 〈…〉
Moab, and his Cities?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He 〈…〉 , and his Cities burnt up, J ••

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
What 〈…〉
•• mon, Edom and Damaſcus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They were •• l laid waſte, Jer. 49.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Ieremiah Propheſie concerning Babylon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Its Deſtruction, and the Deliverance of Iſrael, which was in Captivity, Jer. 50.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Babylon deſtroyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For the Iniquity and Idolatry thereof, Jer. 51.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
In what Year of Zedekiah's Raign wa •
Jeruſalem beſieged by the King of Babylon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the ninth Year, in the tenth Moneth, the tenth day of the Month, Jer. 52. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long was Jeruſalem beſieged?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Until the 11th year of his raign Jer. 52. 5.

p.hi: When was the City broken up?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the 4th moneth the 9th day. ver. 6, 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What became of Zedekiah, and his Sons, and all the Princes of Judah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The King of Babel took Zedekiah, and put out his Eyes, and bound him in Chains, and carried him to Babel, and put him in Priſon to the day of his death, and ſlew his Sons before his 〈◊〉 , and all the Princes of Judah, verſ.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What became of the 〈…〉 of the Lord in Jeruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Both the Houſe of the Lord and the King's Houſe, and all the Houſes of Jeruſalem did Nabuzaradan, the chief Steward of the King of Babylon, burn with Fire, and brake down all the Walls of the City round about, verſ, 13, 14.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What is the ſubſtance of the Lamentations of Jeremiah?

sp.speaker: M
sp.p: To ſet forth the miſerable ſtate of Jeruſalem in the Land of Judah, for the multitude of their Trangreſſions, Lam. 1, 2, 3, 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: To whom was Ezekiel ſent to Propheſie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto the Children of Iſrael in Captivity, Ezek. 3, 4, 5, 6,

p.hi: What was propheſied concerning them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That God would ſpare a Remnant from the Sword, Famine and Peſtilence, Ezek. 6. 8.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was to be ſpared in the Overthrow of Jeruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: All thoſe whom Ezekiel was commanded to mark, who mourn'd and cry'd for the Abominations that were done in the midſt thereof, Ezek. 9. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Ʋnto what did Ezekiel liken the falſe Prophets of Iſrael?

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Unto Foxes in waſte places, Eze. 13. 4.

p.hi: What was their Error?

sp.speaker: M
sp.p: In ſlaying the ſouls of them that ſhould live, and giving life to them that ſhould dye, verſ. 19.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Tyrus deſtroyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe of its Pride and Preſumption, Ezek 28. 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Zidon laid waſte?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe of the multitude of its Abominations, verſ. 22, 23.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Ezekiel further teſtifie againſt the falſe Prophets of Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they eat the Fat, and cloathed with the Wooll, and killed thoſe that were fed, Ezek. 34. 3.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Ezekiel Propheſie concerning Mount Seir?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That it ſhould be laid deſolate, becauſe the Inhabitants thereof troubled the People of the Lord, Ezek. 35. 4, 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Ʋnto what was the Children of Iſrael likened in their Captivity?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto dry Bones in an open Valley, Ezek. 37. 1, 2, 3, 4.

p.hi: What did God do for them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He cauſed them to come together Bone to his Bone, and brought Fleſh upon them, and breathed Life into them, and they became the whole Houſe of Iſrael, Eze. 37. 10, 11.

p.hi: What did God further promiſe to them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To make them one People, and ſet up one Shepherd over them, Ezek. 37. 22, 24.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was the firſt that ſhould fight againſt the Iſrael of God, after their Restauration?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Gogg and Magogg, Ezek. 38 verſ▪ 16, 17.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Ezekiel propheſie concerning them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That God would deſtroy them, and their great Armies, wherewith they fight againſt Iſrael, Ezek. 39. 2, 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Ezekiel ſee concerning the Temple and City of Ieruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They ſhould be reſtored and built again, Ezek. 40.

p.hi: How did the Glory of God return to the Temple?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the Viſion of Ezekiel, he ſaw the Glory of the Lord come out of the Eaſt, and came into the Temple, whoſe proſpect was towards the Eaſt, Ezek. 43. 2, 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was Iſrael Reproved of the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For bringing into the Sanctuary of the Lord the Uncircumciſed in Heart and Fleſh, Ezek. 44. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who did God chuſe after Ezekiel to bear witneſs of Him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Daniel, Shadrach, Meſhach, and Abednego, Dan. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was King of Babylon in the days of Daniel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Nebuchadnezar, Dan. 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did God manifeſt his Power and Wiſdom through Daniel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In interpreting Nebuchadnezzar's Dream, which all the Wiſe-men of Babylon could not do, verſ. 9, 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did God manifeſt his Power with Shadrach, Meſhach and Abednego?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In delivering them out of the midſt of the burning Furnace, Dan. 3. 23.

p.hi: By whom were they caſt in and for what?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Nebuchadnezzar King of Babylon, for refuſing to bow down to the Image he had ſet up, verſ. 26.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Nebuchadnezzar's Dream?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Concerning a great Tree and ſtrong, whoſe height reached to Heaven, and the ſight thereof to the Ends of the Earth, &c. Dan. 4. 10, 11, 12.

p.hi: What did this great Tree ſignifie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The King Nebuchadnezzar, verſ. 19.

p.hi: What did the Fall thereof ſignifie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The fall of the King of Babel, ver. 23.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who Interpreted Nebuchadnezzar's Dream?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Daniel; who warned him to break off his Sins by Repentance, and his Iniquities by ſhewing Mercy to the Poor, verſe 27.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did he hearken to Daniel's Counſel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
No, and therefore his Kingdom was
rent from him, and he was driven from Man, and did eat Graſs as Oxen, and his Body was wet with the Dew of Heaven, till his Hairs were like Eagles Feathers, and his Nailes like Birds Claws, verſe 33.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was King of Babylon after him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Belſhazzer his Son, Dan. 5. 2.

p.hi: Did he deſpiſe the Idols of his Father?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No, he praiſed them, verſe 4.

p.hi: How did God appear againſt him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He cauſed the Fingers of a Man's Hand to appear upon the Plaſter of the Wall of the King's Pallace, and to write, Mene, Mene, Tekel, Upharſin, verſ. 5. & 25.

p.hi: What was the interpretation theroof?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: 1. That God had number'd his Kingdom, and finiſhed it.
2. That the King was weighed in the Ballance, and found too light.
3. That his Kingdom was divided, and given to the Medes and Perſians, ver. 26, 27, 28.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was King of Babylon after him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Darius, verſ. 31.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did he for Daniel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He preferred him above all the Governours of his Kingdom, becauſe an excelent Spirit, Light and Underſtanding was found in him, Dan. 6. 2, 3. chap. 5. 11, 14.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: For what did the Rulers of Darius ſeek to deſtroy Daniel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For Praying unto his God, verſ. 11.

p.hi: How?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: When they could find no other Fault in him, they cauſed Darius to make a Decree, That whoſoever ſhould ask a Petition of any other God or Man, for thirty days, ſave of King Darius, ſhould be caſt into the Den of Lyons, verſ. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did Daniel condeſcend to the King herein?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; for he prayed to his God as at other times, Dan. 6. 10.

p.hi: Was he caſt into the Den of Lyons for Praying?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea; but the Angel of God ſhut the Lyons Mouthes, that he had no Harm, verſ. 22.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How was Daniel delivered out of the Den?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Kings Commandment, Dan. 6. 23.

p.hi: What became of his Accuſars?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The King commanded them to be caſt into the Den of Lyons, verſ. 24.

p.hi: Were they preſerved in the Den?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
No; for the Lyons had Maſtry over
them and broke all their Bones in pieces ere they came at the Ground of the Den, verſ. 24.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Daniel's next Viſion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Concerning four Beaſts, that aroſe out of the Sea, Dan. 7. 3.

p.hi: What was the firſt like unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto a Lyon, and had Eagles Wings, and a Man's Heart was given him, verſ. 4.

p.hi: What was the ſecond Beaſt like unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto a Bear; and it was ſaid unto him, Ariſe, and devour much Fleſh, verſ. 5.

p.hi: What was the third Beaſt like unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto a Leoaprd, which had upon his Back f • ur Wings of a Fowl; and the Beaſt had four Heads, and Dominion was given unto him, verſ. 6.

p.hi: What was the fourth Beaſt like unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He was fearful, and terrible, and very ſtrong, and had great Iron Teeth, who devoured, and brake to pieces, and ſtamped the reſidue under his Feet; and was unlike to the Beaſts that were before it; for it had ten Horns, verſ. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Daniel further ſee?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
The Ancient of Dayes ſit upon his Throne, whoſe Garment was white as Snow, and the Hair of his Head like pure
Wool; before whom Ten Thouſand Thouſands ſtood, and the Judgment was ſet, and the Books open'd, verſ. 9, 10.

p.hi: What became of the firſt great and terrible Beaſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He was ſlain, and his Body deſtroyed, and given to the Burning Fire, verſ. 11. What became of the other Beaſts?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: their Dominion was taken away, yet their Lives were prolong'd for a ſeaſon, verſ. 12.

p.hi: What did the four Beaſts ſignifie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Four Kings that ſhould ariſe out of the Earth, who ſhould take the Kingdom of the Saints of the Moſt High, and ſhould make War againſt the Saints, and ſhould prevail againſt them, verſ. 17, 18.

p.hi: How long were they to prevail!

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Until the Ancient of Dayes came, and Judgment was given to the Saints of the Moſt High, who ſhould poſſes the Kingdom, Dan. 7. 22.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Daniel's next Viſion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of a Battle between a Ram and a Goat, Dan. 8. 3.

p.hi: What did the Ram with his two Horns ſignifie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Kings of the Meeds and Perſians, verſ. 20.

p.hi: What did the Goat ſignifie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The King of Grecia, verſe 21.

p.hi: What was ſignified by the puſhing of the Ram every way, ſo that no Beaſt could ſtand before him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The great Power and ſtrength of the Kings of the Meeds and Perſians, verſ. 4.

p.hi: What was ſignified by the Horn that appeared between the Goat's Eyes, with which he deſtroyed the Ram?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The firſt King of Grecia, who was to ſubdue the King of the Meeds and Perſians, and ſtamp them under his Feet, ſo that none could deliver them out of his Power, Dan. 8. 21.

p.hi: Againſt whom did the Goat bend his ſtrength?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Againſt the Mighty and Holy People, and againſt the Prince of Princes; but he was to be broken without hands, verſ. 24, 25.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Daniel's Petition to God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To return the Captivity of Iſrael out of Babylon, Dan. 9. 16, 17, 18.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Daniel's next Viſion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of the Appearance of the Son of Man, Dan. 10. 5, 6, 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did he ſhew to Daniel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
All the Kingdoms▪ which ſhould be
Enemies to the Church of God, as of Perſia, Greece, of Aegypt, Syria, and of the Romans, Dan. 11.

p.hi: What was the End of all theſe Kings, and what was promiſed to the Church of Christ?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Deſtruction to themſelves, and Deliverance to the Juſt, with the Reſurrection thereof. and of the Un juſt, Dan. 12.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Of what did Hoſea Propheſie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of the Calling of the Gentiles, as well as the Jews; and that Chriſt ſhould be Head of them all, Hoſea 1. 10, 11.

p.hi: What was his Complaint?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That the Land of Iſrael was full of Adulterers; and by Lying, Swearing, Killing, Stealing and Whoring, ſo that Blood toucheth Blood, Hoſ. 4. 2.
2dly, That their Prieſts and Rulers had been as a Snare to Miſpah, and a Net ſpread upon Tabor, Hoſea 5. 1.
3dly, That as Troops of Robbers wait for a man, ſo the Company of Prieſts Murder in the way by Conſent; for they commit Lewdneſs, Hoſ. 6. 9.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the ſubſtance of Hoſea's Prophecy?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
To demonſtrate the Abominations and Miſeries of Iſrael, Aegypt and Ephraim;
and how the Lord would utterly caſt them off in his Wrath, Hoſ. 8. & 9.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Joel's Propheſie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Againſt the Jews, whom he exhorted to Prayer and faſting, for the Miſery that was at hand, Joel 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did the Lord promiſe by the Mouth of Joel in the latter dayes?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To pour out his Spirit upon all Fleſh; that his Sons and Daughters ſhould Propheſie, &c. Jo. 2. 28.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Subſtance of the Prophecy of Amos?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The denouncing of God's continued Judgments upon Iſrael, Judah, Tyrus, Edom and Amon, for their continued Abominations, Amos 1, 2, 3. chap.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Of what Calling was Amos?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: An Herdſman, Amos 1. 1. & 7. 14?

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: For what was the Lamentation of Amos.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For the Captivity of Iſrael, Amos 5?

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did God ſignifie by a Line to Amos.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Deſtruction of the People Iſrael, Amos 7. 7, 8.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did God further ſhew to Amos concerning Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: A Famine amongſt them of the Word of the Lord, for their Rebellion, Amos 8. 11, 12.

p.hi: What was God's Promiſe to his Church in thoſe dayes?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Its Reſtauration; ſo that the Plowman ſhould reach the Mower • , and the Treader of Grapes him that ſoweth Seed, &c. Amos 9. 11, 12, 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Viſion of Obad iah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Word of the Lord againſt Edom, and its Inhabitants, who were of the ſtock of Eſau, Obad. 1. 1.

p.hi: What was the Word of the Lord concerning them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Againſt their Pride and High-mindedneſs, in exalting themſelves againſt the Seed of Jacob, Obad. 3. 8, 9, 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Word of the Lord to Jonah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To go and preach Repentance to Nineveth, the chief City of the Aſſyrians, Jonah 1. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Was Jonah obedient to the Word of the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; for he fled to Tarſhiſh, from the Preſence of the Lord, verſ. 3.

p.hi: How did God ſtop his way?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By a mighty Tempeſt at Sea, verſ. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How was it known that Jonah was the Cauſe why the Ship was in Danger to be loſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
By the Lots which the Marriner •
caſt, to know for whoſe Cauſe that great Tempeſt was in the Sea, verſ. 7.

p.hi: How was the Tempeſt in the Sea aſwaged?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By caſting of Jonah into the Sea, v. 15.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: By what was Jonah preſerved in the Sea?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By a Whale, which God had prepared to ſwallow him up, who, at the Word of the Lord caſt Jonah upon the dry Land, Jonah 1. 17. & 2. 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Whither did God ſend Jonah afterwards?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Nineveth, Jonah 3. 2.

p.hi: Did he obey the Word of the Lord the ſecond time?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, and went a dayes Journey into Nineveth, and cry'd, Yet Forty Days and Nineveth ſhall be deſtroyed, verſe 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did the King, and People of Nineveth, Repent at the Preaching of Jonah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, and turned from their Evil Wayes, ſo that God repented of the Evil that he had intended againſt them, and he did it not, verſ. 8, 9, 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Of what did Micah Propheſie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of the Deſtruction of Judah and Iſrael, becauſe of their Idolatry, Mic. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Iniquity of the Princes and Prieſts of Judah and Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
The Heads thereof judged for Rewards,
and the Prieſts thereof taught for Hire, &c. Mic. 3. 11.

p.hi: What did God Promiſe in the latter dayes?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Eſtabliſhment of the Kingdom of Chriſt, and felicity of his Church, Mic. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Ʋnto what did Micah liken the beſt of the Houſe of Iſrael?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto a Bryar, and the moſt pure amongſt them ſharper then a Thorn Hedge, Mic. 7. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Of what did Nahum Propheſie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of the Deſtruction of the Aſſyrians, and the Deliverance of Iſrael, Nahum 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What became of their chief City Nineveh?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: It was deſtroy'd, becauſe of the multitude of its Forninations, Nahum 3. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Habbakkuk's Complaint?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Againſt the Wicked that perſecuted the Juſt, Hab. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Prophecy of Zepheniah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Againſt Judah and Jeruſalem for their Idolatry, Zeph. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the ſubſtance of the Prophecy of Haggai, Zacheriah and Malachi?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
They were raiſed up to Comfort the Jews, after the ſeventy years of their Captivity
was ended, to exhort them to build the Temple again; which was a Figure of the ſpiritual Temple and Church of God, whoſe Perfection and Excellency ſtood in Chriſt, Hag. 1, 2. cap. Zach. 1, 2, 3. cap.
2ly, To call the Jews home to Jeruſalem by the Word of the Lord, and to make them a Bleſſing.
3ly, The calling of the Gentiles, and the coming of Chriſt, Zach. 8, 9. cap.
4ly, The coming of John Baptist, who was to prepare the Way of the Lord, Mal. 3. 1.
5ly, Of the coming of the great and terrible day of the Lord, wherein all the Proud, and all that did wickedly, ſhould be as ſtubble, before which Eliah the Prophet ſhould come, Mal. 4. 1, 5.

p.hi: VVHO wrote the firſt Book of the New-Teſtament in the Bible?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Matthew.

p.hi: What doth it contain?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Geneology of Chriſt, the Time and Place of his Birth, his Sufferings, Temptations, Baptiſm, and Doctrine, Mat. 1. 2, 3, 4.

p.hi: Where was Chriſt born, and of whom was he baptized?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He was born of a pure Virgin, who was eſpouſed to Joſeph, being found with Child of the Holy Ghoſt, verſ. 18.
2dly, Chriſt was baptized of John in Jordan, Mat. 3. 15.

p.hi: Who was the first King that ſought to deſtroy Chriſt after his Birth?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Herod, Mat. 2. 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did he eſcape Herod's hand?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Angel of God appeared to Joſeph in a Dream, and commanded him to take the Young Child, and flee into Egypt, who remained there till the Death of Herod, verſ. 13, 14, 15.

p.hi: What was the firſt Temptation which Chriſt ſuſtained from the Devil?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: After he had faſted Forty Days, he tempted him, to command Stones to be made Bread, Mat. 4. 3.

p.hi: What was his ſecond Temptation?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To caſt himſelf down from the Pinacle of the Temple, verſ. 5.

p.hi: What was his third Temptation?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To fall down and worſhip the Devil, verſ. 9.

p.hi: How did he overcome the Evil One?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By reſiſting his Temptations by the Power of God, in which he ſtood, verſ. 10.

p.hi: How was the Power of God manifeſted to the World through him by Miracles?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: 1ſt, In healing the Sick of the Palſie, Mat. 9, 2.
2ly, In healing of the Woman who had a Bloody-Iſſue, verſ. 22.
3ly, In raiſing Jara's Daughter to Life, ver. 25.
4ly, In reſtoring the Blind to ſight, ver. 29, 30.
5ly, In making the Dumb to ſpeak, and healing every Sickneſs, verſ. 33, 34, 35.

p.hi: By whom was the Twelve Apoſtles ſent out?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Chriſt; who gave them Power againſt unclean ſpirits, to caſt them out, and to heal every Sickneſs, Mat. 10. 1.

p.hi: Unto what did Christ liken the Kingdom of Heaven?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto a man that ſowed good Seed in his Field, Mat. 13. 24.

p.hi: What was the Enemy's Work at that day?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To ſow Tares among the good Seed, verſ. 25.

p.hi: Who ſowed the good Seed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Son of Man, verſ. 37.

p.hi: What was the Field in which it was ſown?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The World; and the good Seed were the Children of the Kingdom, verſ. 38.

p.hi: What was the Tares?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Children of the Wicked One, verſ. 38.

p.hi: How many did Chriſt feed with five Loaves and two Fiſhes?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Five Thouſand Men beſides Women and Children, Matth. 14. 19, 20.

p.hi: What remained after the Multitude was ſufficed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Twelve Baskets full, verſ. 24.

p.hi: How many did Chriſt feed with ſeven Loves?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Seven Thouſand beſides Women and Children, Mat. 15. 38.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why did the Scribes and Phariſees require a Sign from Heaven?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe they were a Wicked and an Adulterous Generation, Matth 16. 4.

p.hi: Did Chriſt give them a Sign?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No, ſave the Sign of the Prophet Jonah, Jonah 4.

p.hi: What did the Parable of the Vineyard ſignifie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Unworthyneſs of the Jews, unto whom many Prophets and Servants of God had been ſent, whom they had beaten and killed; and alſo, how they would kill the Son of the Heir alſo, Matth. 21. 33, 34, 35, 36, 37, 38.

p.hi: What did the Parable of the Marriage of the King's Son ſignifie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
The many Invitations which the Jews had, to come to the Marriage of the Lamb, and to the Table
of the Lord, which they regarded not, Mat. 22. 5.

p.hi: What was the King's Sentence againſt thoſe who ſleighted his Invitations?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To ſend forth Warriors to deſtroy them, and to invite Gueſs out of the Hedges and High-Wayes, that the Wedding might be furniſhed, verſ. 9, 10.

p.hi: Were they all worthy that came to the Marriage Dinner?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No, there came one who had not the Wedding-Garment, verſ. 11.

p.hi: What was the King's Sentence againſt him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To bind him Hand and Foot, and caſt him into utter Darkneſs, there ſhall be Weeping and Gnaſhing of Teeth, verſ. 13.

p.hi: What was the Parable of the Ten Virgins?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
to ſhew unto the Scribes and Phariſees the Folly of their Out-ſide
Worſhip, and the neceſſity of the Life within, Mat. 25.

p.hi: What was ſignified by the Tallents?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To demonſtrate the difference between the Profitable and Unprofitable Servants, and that both had a Tallent given to profit withal, verſ. 15. to verſ. 30.

p.hi: Who conſulted together to kill Jeſus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Chief Prieſts, and Scribes, and Elders of the People, Mat. 26. 3, 4.

p.hi: By whom was he delivered into their hands?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Judas Iſcariot, one of the twelve Diſciples, verſ. 48, 57.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: For what did Judas Iſcariot deliver him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For thirty Pieces of Silver, verſ. 15.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who delivered Christ bound to Pontius Pilate?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Chief Prieſts and Elders, Mat. 27. 2.

sp.speaker: S
sp.p: What became of Judas who betrayed Chriſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He Hanged himſelf, verſ. 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why would Pilate have releaſed Jeſus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe he knew that for Envy the Jews had delivered Jeſus to him to be Crucified, Mat. 27. 17, 18.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who did the Jews deſire to be releaſed, and who to be crucified?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They cryed out, Let Barrabbas be Looſed, and let Jeſus be Crucified, Mat. 27. 21, 22.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did they looſe Barrabbas, and crucifie Jeſus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, verſ. 26, 35.

p.hi: Who did they crucifie with him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Two Thieves, one on his Right Hand, and the other on his left, verſ. 38.

p.hi: Who took his Body from the Croſs?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Joſeph; and wrapped it in a Linnen Cloath, and put it in a new
Sepulchre which he had hew'd out of a Rock, Mat. 27. 59, 60.

p.hi: When did God raiſe Chriſt from the dead?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Within three dayes, as Chriſt had foretold, Mat. 28. 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who ſhew'd unto Mary Magdalen, & the other Mary the Reſurrection of Jeſus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: An Angel from Heaven, v. 5, 6.

p.hi: Unto whem did he firſt appear after his Reſurrection?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto Mary Magdalen and the other Mary, as they were going to tell his Diſciples of his Reſurrection, and afterwards to his Diſciples in Galilee, verſ. 9, 17.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Chriſt's Work in Galilee?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To preach the Goſpel throughout all their Synagogues, Mark 1. 39.
2ly To heal the Palſie and caſt out the Unclean Spirit, Mark 1. 26. and 2. 4, 5.

p.hi: What did Chriſt declare to the People by the Sower of Seed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The ſtate of the Kingdom of God, Mark 4.

p.hi: How many Sorts of Ground was the ſeed of the Kingdom Sown in?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Four Sorts; The High-Way Ground, the Stony Ground, the Thorny Ground, and the Good Ground, Mark 4. 4, 5, 6, 7, 8.

p.hi: How many of them brought forth Fruit to Perfection?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: None but the Good Ground, Mark 4. 8.

p.hi: Why did not the other three bring forth Fruit?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe the firſt retained not the ſeed at all, but the Fowls of the Air devoured it; and the ſecond but a little while, in which it having no depth of Earth withered a way; the third being Thorny, the ſeed was Choaked, ſo that it yelded no Fruit, Mark 4. 4, 5, 6, 7.

p.hi: Why was the Kingdom of God likened to a Grain of Muſterd ſeed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To ſhew the Smalneſs of the Seed of the Kingdom when it is firſt ſown, and how great it is when grown up, Mark 4. 31, 32.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who Beheaded John Baptiſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Herod, Mark 6. 27.

p.hi: Who was the cauſe thereof?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Herodias, his Brothers Philip's Wife, verſ. 24.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why did the Phariſees Condemn the diſciples of Jeſus for Eating with Unwaſhed Hands?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe they preferred the Traditions of the Elders before the Commandments of God, Mark 7. 8.

p.hi: What did Chriſt ſay did Defile the Man?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Not to eat with Unwaſhed Hands; nor that which entereth in at the Mouth, but that which came out of the Mouth from the heart, as vain Thoughts, Murders, &c. Mark 7. 18, & 20. 21, 22.

p.hi: Where was Chriſt Transfigured before his Diſciples?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In an High Mountain apart, Mark 9. 2.

p.hi: What did Chriſt demonſtrate to his Diſciples by the Vineyard?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Juſtice of God againſt the Jews, who had beaten his Servants, and ſlain his Son, Mark 12. 2, 3, 4.

p.hi: What was the Portion of theſe Huſband men?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To be deſtroyed, and the Vineyard to be taken from them, and given to others, Mark 12. 9.

p.hi: Who wrote the Third Book of the New Teſtament in the Bible?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Luke the Evangeliſt.

p.hi: What was the Subſtance of that Book.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: A Rechearſal of what Matthew and Mark before had written of the Birth, Death, Sufferings, Temptations and Works of Chriſt.

p.hi: Who wrote the Fourth Book of the New Teſtament?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: John the Evangeliſt.

p.hi: What was his firſt Teſtimony of Chriſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of his Divinity; for his name was called the Word of God, by which all things were made, which Word became Fleſh, Joh. 1, 1, 14.

p.hi: What was his further Teſtimony of him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That he was the true Light, who lighted every man that came into the World, verſ. 9.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was John Baptiſt's Office and Commiſſion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Baptize with water, John 1. 31.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Chriſt's Office or Work?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Baptize with the holy Ghoſt and with fire, verſ. 33.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the firſt Miracle that Jeſus did in Cana of Galilee after his Reſurrection?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Turning of Water into Wine at the Marriage, John 2. 8.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the New Birth which Chriſt Spoke of to Nicodemus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
The Birth of the Spirit, which
he could not underſtand, John 3. 8.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did John ſay was the Condemnation of the World?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That Light was come into the World, and men loved Darkneſs rather then Light, becauſe their Deeds were Evil, John 3. 19.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Where did the woman of Samaria meet with Chriſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: At Jacob's Well at Sychar a City of Samaria, John 4. 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did He teſtifie to the Woman of Samaria?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That the True Worſhippers ſhould worſhip the Father in Spirit and Truth, Joh. 4. 23, 24.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Wherefore did the Jews ſeek Occaſion to ſlay Chriſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe He healed a Man that was Sick eight and thirty years on the Sabbath-Day, John 5. 16.

p.hi: What did Chriſt call himſelf?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Bread of Life, John 6. 35.

p.hi: Whom did Chriſt ſay, came unto him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Thoſe who had Heard and Learned of the Father, and whom the Father drew, John 6. 44, 45.

p.hi: Whom did Chriſt ſay, could Eat his Fleſh, and Drink his Blood?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Thoſe who dwelt in him, and They, in whom He dwelt, verſ. 5, 6.

p.hi: What was the Living Bread of which Chriſt ſpoke?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: His Fleſh, which He would give for the Life of the World, verſ. 5.

p.hi: Could his Diſciples receive theſe Words?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No, for they judged it a Hard Saying, verſ. 60.

p.hi: What did Jeſus again teſtifie of Himſelf?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That He was the Light of the World, and He who followed Him ſhould not abide in Darkneſs, but ſhould have the Light of Life, John 8. verſ. 12.

p.hi: What did Chriſt ſay of the Scribes and Phariſees?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they were of their Father the Devil, and the Luſt of their Father they would do, Joh. 8. 44.

p.hi: What was Chriſt's further Teſtimony of Himſelf?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That He was the Good Shepherd, John 10. 11.

p.hi: What was his Teſtimony of a Hireling?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That the Hireling, whoſe the Sheep is not, ſeeth the Wolf coming fleeth, and leaves the Sheep, verſ. 12, 13.

p.hi: What doth the Good Shepherd for his Sheep?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He knoweth his Sheep, and is known of them, and layeth down his Life for his Sheep, verſ. 14, 15.

p.hi: How is the Sheep of Chriſt known?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They hear his Voyce and follow him, and He giveth unto them Eternal Life, Joh. 10. 27, 28.

p.hi: What other Miracle did Chriſt in the Sight of the Jews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
He raiſed Lazarus from the Dead
who had been dead four dayes, Joh. 11. 39, 43, 44.

p.hi: Who firſt conſpired the Death of Chriſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Caiphas the High-Prieſt, he with the Phariſees ſaying, If we let him alone all People will believe on him, and the Romans would come, and take their City and Nation, John 11. 48.

p.hi: What was ſignified by the Parable of the Wheat-Corn?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That thoſe who would live with Chriſt, and bring forth Fruit, ſhould dye with Him, John 12. 24, 25.

p.hi: Unto what did Chriſt exhort his Diſciples and Followers?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To walk in the Light while they had the Light, leaſt Darkneſs came upon them, verſ. 35, 36.

p.hi: For what End came Chriſt into the World?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That whoſoever believed in him ſhould not abide in Darkneſs, verſ. 46.

p.hi: Who were they whom Chriſt ſaid Loved Him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They who had his Commandments, and kept them, John 13. 21.

p.hi: Why did Chriſt go away in the Fleſh out of the World?

sp.speaker: M.
