sp.p: That He might come again in the Spirit, Joh. 14. 28.

p.hi: What was the Comforter which Chriſt promiſed to ſend his Diſciples after his Departure, which ſhould teach them all things?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Spirit of Truth which the World could not receive, John 14. 17. & 16. 7.

p.hi: Whom did Chriſt call his Friends?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Thoſe who did his Commandments, John 15. 14.

p.hi: What was the Office of the Comforter whom Chriſt would ſend?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To reprove the World of Sin, of Righteouſneſs and Judgment.

p.hi: Why of Sin?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe they believe not on him, verſ. 9.

p.hi: Why of Righteouſneſs?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Becauſe He went to the Father,
and they ſaw Him no more, verſ. 10.

p.hi: Why of Judgment?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe the Prince of this World was judged, verſ. 11.

p.hi: Why was the Diſciples of Chriſt hated of the World?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe they were not of the World, even as He was not of the World, John 17. 14.

p.hi: Who writ the Acts of the Apoſtles?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Luke the Evangeliſt, Act. 1.

p.hi: What is the Subſtance of that Book?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Wonderfull Work of the Lord in pouring out of his Spirit upon his Sons and Daughters, according to his Promiſe by Joel 2. 28. Act. 1. 2 Chap.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did the Holy Ghoſt manifeſt itſelf to the Apoſtles as they waited at Jeruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: As the Ruſhing of a mighty Wind from Heaven, and it filled the Houſe where they ſate, Act. 2. 2.

p.hi: What Miracles did the Apoſtles after
they had received the Holy Ghoſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Firſt, Three Thouſand was added to the Church by Peter's Sermon, Acts 2. 41.
2. The Raiſing of the Criple who ſat at the Gate of the Temple, Acts 3. 6, 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Wherefore was Ananias and Saphira deſtroyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For Lying againſt the Holy Ghoſt, Acts 5. 5, 6, 7, 8.

p.hi: How did God manifeſt his Power unto the Apoſtle in Priſon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In bringing them out when the Doors were ſhut, and Keepers watching, Acts 5. 23.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was Stephen's Teſtimony for God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That He dwelt not in Temples made with hands, Acts 7. 48.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Wherefore did they Stone Stephen to Death?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For Teſtifying unto Jeſus the Reſurrection, Acts 7. 57, 58.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: By whom was Samaria Seduced

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Simon Magus, Acts 8. 9, 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How came Simon Magus to believe the Goſpel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Preaching of Philip, and the Power, and Authority that God manifeſted with him, Acts 8. verſ. 12, 13.

p.hi: By whom was the Eunuch (the Queen of the Aethiopians chief Governour) Converted and Baptized?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Philip, Acts 8. 35, 36, 37, 38.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who was the greateſt Perſecutour of the Church of Chriſt among the Jews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Saul, Acts 8. 3, & 9, 1.

p.hi: How came he to be ſtop't from Perſecution, and to beleeve the Goſpel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He was ſtruck down by a Light from Heaven, and a Voyce from God ſaying Saul, Saul why perſecuteſt thou me, Acts 9. 4.

p.hi: Whither was he going when the Lord Smote him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
To Damaſcus with Letters from
the high Prieſts to perſecute the Diſciples of Chriſt, whether men or women, and to bring them bound to Jeruſalem, Acts 9. 1, 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: By whom did Paul Receive his Sight?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Ananias, who put his Hands upon him, and his Eyes were opened, and he Received the Holy Ghoſt, and ſtraight-way preached Chriſt in Damaſcus, Acts 9. 17, 18, 12, 20.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did Saul continue with the Diſciples ſtedfast in Faith and Doctrine?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, and preached Chriſt boldly in the Synagogues, and confounded the Jews, both at Damaſcus, and at Jeruſalem, inſomuch that the Jews took Counſel together to Kill him, Acts 9. 21, 22, 23.

p.hi: How was he delivered out of their Hands?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Diſciples who put him through the wall, and let him down in a Basket, Acts 9. 25.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was ſignified by Peter's Viſion of the veſſel let down from Heaven, in which was all manner of four-footed Beaſts, Fowles of the Air, and Creeping Things?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That God would not Reſpect the Perſon of the Jew, nor Gentile, but of every Nation, they who feared him, and wrought Righteouſneſs was Accepted of him, Acts 10. 34, 35.

p.hi: Who was next Perſecutour of the Chriſtians?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Herod who Killed James the Brother of John with the Sword, and took Peter and put him in Priſon, Acts 12. 1, 2, 3.

p.hi: How did God manifeſt his Diſpleaſure againſt him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He ſent his Angel who ſmote him, and he was eaten of Worms, Acts 12. 23.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Whom did God ordain to be Paul's Companion to Preach the Goſpel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Barnabas, Acts 13. 2.

p.hi: Who firſt withſtood their Doctrine?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Elymas the Sorcerer, Acts 13. 8.

p.hi: How did God manifeſt his wrath againſt him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In ſmiting him with Blindneſs, ſo that he went about ſeeking ſome to lead him by the hand, verſ. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did the Jews Receive the Teſtimony of Paul and Barnabas?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No, for they were full of Envy, and ſpake againſt them, and railed on them, ſo that they turned to the Gentiles, verſ. 45, 46.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did the Gentiles believe the Goſpel?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea, with Gladneſs, and Glorified the Word of God, Acts 13. 47, 48.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Whither went Paul and Barnabas, after?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Iconium and Lyſtra, where the Jews cauſed Paul to be ſtoned, and drew him out of the City for dead, Acts 14. 1, 19.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Was the Gentiles, who did believe, enjoyned to be Circumciſed after the Law of Moſes?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No, they were only to abſtain from Filthineſs of Idols and fornication, from things ſtrangled, and from Blood.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who Circumciſed Timothy?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul becauſe of the Jews that was in thoſe Quarters knowing all that his Father was a Grecian, Acts 16. 3.

p.hi: How was the Damſel healed who had the Spirit of Divinations?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Power and Spirit of God in Paul for which her Maſter caus'd Paul and Sylas to be ſore beaten and caſt into Priſon, Acts 16. 18, 21, 22, 23.

p.hi: How did God deliver them and looſe their hands?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By a mighty Power from Heaven, which ſhook the Foundation of the Priſon, and opened all the Doors, and looſed every mans Bonds, verſ. 26.

p.hi: Did the Goaler feel the mighty Power of God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Yea, he and his whole houſe
was Converted and baptized, Act 16. 32, 33.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Whither did Paul paſs after he was ſet at Liberty?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Theſſalonica, where he went into a ſynagogue of the Jews, and preached unto them Chriſt, Acts 17. 2, 3, 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did the Jews Receive him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Some of them believed, and they who believed not made a Tumult in the City, and aſſaulted the houſe of Jaſon to bring Paul and Silas
• ut to the People, verſ. 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How did Paul and Silas eſcape their • ands?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
They were ſent away by night • o Berea, where the Bereans received • he word with all readineſs, and ſear
• hed the Scriptures daily whether • heſe things were ſo, Acts 17. 10, 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Whither did Paul paſs from Berea?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
To Athens where he ſhewed the
• thenians their Idolatry, and that
God who made the World dwelt not in Temples made with hands, v. 24, 25.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Whither did Paul paſs from Athens?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Corinthus, where he found Aquila and Pricilla, who was come out of Italy at the Command of Claudius, Acts 18. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: How long did Paul continue at Corinthus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: A Year and ſix Moneths, teaching the Word of God, verſ. 11.

p.hi: What Miracles was done by him there?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The holy Ghoſt was given unto the Diſciples by the laying on of his Hands, Acts 19. 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did not the Vagabond Jews, when they ſaw what miracles was done by the hand of Paul, take upon them to Caſt out the Unclean Spirits in the name of Jeſus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Yea they did, but that Evil Spirit overcame them, and ran upon them, ſo that they fled out naked and wounded, Acts 13. 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who raiſed Eutychus from the dead?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, Acts 20. 10, 12.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who Propheſied of Paul's Bonds at Jeruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Agabus, a Prophet of Judea, Act. 21. 10, 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Where was Paul taken at Jeruſalem?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the Temple, where the Jews moved the People againſt him, ſaying he taught all men every where againſt the People, and the Law, and brought Grecians into the Temple poluting that Holy Place, Acts 21. 27, 28.
What did the People to Paul?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They took him and drew him out of the Temple and beat him, intending to kill him, verſ. 30. 31.

p.hi: What hindred them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Tydings of an uproar in Jeruſalem, verſ. 31, 32.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What became of Paul afterwards?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Chief Captain delivered him to be Scurged, Acts 22. 24.

p.hi: How did he eſcape their hands?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By pleading that he was a Roman, and uncondemned, Acts 22. 25.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who accuſed Paul to the Governour?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Turtullus a certain Orator, and of the Jews alſo who could not prov • their Accuſations, Acts 24. 1, 9, 13▪

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p:
Of what did Paul reaſon befor •
Felix?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Of Righteouſneſs, Temperanc • and Judgment to come which cauſe •
Falix to Tremble, Acts 24. 26.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: For what end was Paul ſent to th • Gentiles?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To open the eyes of the Blin • and to turn them from darkneſs t • Light, and from the Power of Sata • unto God, &c. Acts 26. 1.

p.hi: Who first writ to the Romans?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, Rom. 1. Chap.

p.hi: What was the Goſpel he Preached t • them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Power of God to Salvatio • to every one that believed Rom. 1. 16.

p.hi: Why was the wrath of God reveale • from Heaven againſt all ungodlineſs an • unrighteouſneſs of men?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe that which might be known of God was manifeſted in them &c. Rom. 1. 18, 19.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Why was the Gentiles juſtified rather then the Jews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Becauſe, the Jews believed not, but were only Hearers of the Law outwardly; but the Gentles believing, did the things Contained in the Law, having it written in their hearts Rom. 2. 13, 14, 15. Chap. 9. 30, 31.

p.hi: Was any man juſtified by the works of the Law?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No, Rom. 3. 20.

p.hi: How is man juſtified before God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Freely by the grace of God through the Redemption that is in Chriſt Jeſus, Rom. 3. 24.

p.hi: How Long did ſin and death raign over all mankind?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: From Adam till Moſes, even over them that had not ſinned after the ſimilitude of Adams tranſgreſſion, Rom. 4. 14.

p.hi: How came ſin and death to be deſtroyed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By the Reigning of Grace through righteouſnes to Eternal Life, Rom. 5. 21.

p.hi: What is the Wages of ſin?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Death; but the gift of God is Eternal Life through Jeſus Chriſt our Lord, Rom 6. 23.

p.hi: Who are Sons and Heirs of God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Thoſe who are Led by the Spirit of God Rom, 8. 14.

p.hi: In what doth the Election of God ſtand?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In the promiſed Seed, which is Chriſt, Rom. 9. 8. Gal. 3. 16. Epheſ. 1. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: In what was Jſraels Blindneſs and Ignorance?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In that they had a Zeal for God, but not according to knowledge, being Ignorant of Gods righteouſneſs, and going about to Eſtabliſh their own, Rom. 10. 2, 3.

p.hi: In what did the Righteouſneſs of Faith conſiſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
In Hearing, Believing, and Obeying
the Word of Faith, which was nigh, in the Heart, and in the Mouth, Rom. 10. 6, 7, 8.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: By what did the Gentiles ſtand upon the Root, when the Jews were broken off?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: By Faith, Rom. 11. 20.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Paul exhort the Romans unto in the Twelfth Chapter?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Not to Faſhion themſelves according to the Courſe of this World &c. Rom. 12. 1, 2.

p.hi: What did He further excite them unto in the Thirteenth Chapter?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To be Subject to the Higher Powers, which were a Terror to Evildoers, and a Praiſe to them who did Well, Rom. 13. 3, 4.

p.hi: What did He further enjoyn them unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they might not Judge one another in Meats or Drinks, or in reſpect of an Holy Day, Rom 14. 13.

p.hi: How were they to Eat, and keep a Day to the Lord?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
They were to Eat in Faith; for he
that Doubted was Condemned if he Eat, and whatſoever was not of Faith was Sin, Rom. 14. 23.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Concluſion of Paul's Epiſtle to the Romans?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To exhort them to Love one another by the Example of Chriſt, and to beware of Falſe Brethren, who through good Words, and Fair Speeches deceive the Hearts of the Simple, Rom. 16. 17, 18.

p.hi: Who writ the firſt Epiſtle to the Corinthians?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, who exhorted them to be of one Mind, and to ſpeak one thing; and to avoid Contentions, 1 Cor. 1. 10, 11, 12.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: For what End was the Preaching of Paul amongſt the Corinthians?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That their Faith might not ſtand in the Wiſdom of Words, but in the Power of God, 1 Cor. 2. 5.

p.hi: Was any able to know the things of God without the Spirit of God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No for as no man knew the things of a man, ſave the Spirit of man that was in him, ſo the things of God knew no man, but by the Spirit of God, 1 Cor 2. 11, 12.

p.hi: In what did the Kingdom of God ſtand?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Not in Words, but in Power, 1 Cor. 4. 2 • .

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Paul Exhort Husbands and Wives unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To dwell with each other according to knowledge and not to depart one from another, 1 Cor. 7. Chap.

p.hi: What did he ſay of Circumciſion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He ſaid that neither Circumciſion nor Uncircumciſion availed any thing, but the keeping of the Commandments of God, 1 Cor. 7. 19.

p.hi: What did he ſay to Believers Concerning Meats?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That whatſoever was ſold on the ſhambles they, might Eat asking no queſtion for Conſcience ſake, 1 Cor. 10. 25.

p.hi: What was the Cup of Bleſſing which the Apoſtles Bleſſed?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Communion of the Blood of Chriſt, 1 Cor. 10. 16.

p.hi: What was the Bread which they Brake?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Communion of the Body of Chriſt, verſ. 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Paul ſay Concerning the Reſurrection of the Body?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That God giveth a Body as it pleaſeth him, and to every Seed his own Body, 1 Cor. 15. 37, 38.

p.hi: Where was the Light which gave the Apoſtles the Knowledge of the Glory of God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In their Hearts, which Treaſure they had in Earthen Veſſels, 2 Cor. 4. 6, 7.

p.hi: In what was the Death and Life of Chriſt manifeſted amongſt the Apoſtles?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In their Mortal Fleſh, 2 Cor. 4. verſ. 11.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who wrote the Epiſtle to the Galatians?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, who reproved them for turning to another Goſpel, Gal. 1. 6.

p.hi: What did He teſtifie among them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The End of the Law, and where fore it was added; and the Obedience of Faith, through which they were Sons, and Heirs of God, Gal. 3, 4. Chap.
2ly, The Bondage of the Law, and the Freedom in Chriſt, Gal. 5. 1, 2, 3.
3ly, The Fruits of the Fleſh, and the Fruits of the Spirit, Gal. 5. 19.
4ly, That thoſe that were Chriſt's, had crucified the Fleſh, with the Affections and Luſts, Gal. 5. 24.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who writ the Epiſtle to the Epheſians?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, Epheſ. 1. 1.

p.hi: What is the Subſtance of that Epiſtle?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To ſet forth unto them, being Gentiles, the Glory of Chriſt, and the Unity of the Spirit of Grace, through which they were Sanctified, and to exhort them unto Love and Meekneſs, Chap. 1, 2.

p.hi: What did He Teſtifie of the Light?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That all things that are reproved are made manifeſt by the Light, and that which maketh all things manifeſt is Light, Epheſ. 5. 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Paul Exhort Children▪ unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Obey their Parents, and to Honour their Father & Mother, which is the firſt Commandment with Promiſe, Epheſ. 6. 1, 2, 3.

p.hi: What did he exhort Parents unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Not to provoke their Children to Wrath, but to bring them up in the Admonition of the Lord, Eph. 6. 4

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who writ the Fpiſtle to the Philippians?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, Phil. 1. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did He exhort the Philippians unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Humility by the Example of Chriſt, Phil. 2. 3, 4, 5, 6.

p.hi: What did He Teſtifie of Circumciſion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
That they were the Circumciſion
who worſhipped God in the Spirit, Phil. 3. 3.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who writ the Epiſtle to the Coloſſians?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, who earneſtly prayed for an Increaſe of their Faith and Knowledge, Col. 1. 9.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who wrote the Epiſtle to the Theſſalonians?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, who thanked God for their Stedfaſtneſs in Faith and good Works, 1 Theſſ. 1. 2.

p.hi: What did He Teſtifie of them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they were Children of the Light, and of the Day, therefore exhorted them to Watch, and be Sober, 1 Theſſ. 5. 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who writ the Second Epiſtle to the Theſſalonians?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, who teſtified that their Church was in God the Father, and in the Lord Jeſus Chriſt, 2 Theſſ. 1. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who writ the Epiſtle to Timothy?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Paul, who Exhorted Timothy to
wait upon his office, and to ſee that nothing but the Doctrine of Chriſt was preached, 1 Tim. 1. 3.
2ly, He Exhorteth Women to ara • themſelves in modeſt Aparrel, and no • with Brodered Hair, or Gold, or Pearls, &c, 1 Tim. 2. 9.

3ly, In the 2d Epiſtle he tells him of Perrilous Times, and of the Marks and Fruits of the falſe Prophets; and deſires him to turn away from ſuch who had the Form, but not the Power of Godlineſs, 2 Tim. 3. Chap.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who writ the Epiſtle to Titus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, Titus 1. 1.

p.hi: What is the Subſtance of that Epiſtle?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To ſtir him up to Execute the office of a Biſhop or Overſeer, with all Gravity and Integrity, Tit. 2. 7.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who writ the Epiſtle to Philemon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Paul, who with many Sound Arguments exhorted Philemon to Receive Oneſimus again and to forgive the Injury done him.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What is the Subſtance of the Book of the Hebrews.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Set forth the difference of the firſt and ſecond Prieſthood, and of the Glory, Power and Excellency of the Miniſtry of Chriſt, Heb. 1. to the 8. Chap.
2ly, The ending of the Ceremonies of the Law, and the reaſon of the aboliſhing thereof, becauſe it could not make perfect the comers thereunto, as pertaining to the Conſcience, Chap. 9. 10.

p.hi: What was Faith ſaid to be, to the Hebrews?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Evidence of things, not ſeen, and the Subſtance of things, hoped for, Heb. 11. 1.

p.hi: What was the Effects and Fruits of Faith to our fore-Fathers?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Great victories over their Enemies and a good report, though they received not the promiſe, Heb. 11. whole Chap.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did James call pure Religion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To viſit the Fatherleſs and Widdows, and to keep himſelf unſpotted of the World, James 1. 27.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did James forbid in the Second Chapter?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That his Brethren ſhould not have the Faith of Jeſus with reſpect of Perſons, Jam. 2. 1.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the dead Faith which James Spake of, and what was the Living Faith?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That dead Faith was without works, and the Living Faith wrought by Love, James 2. 20.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did James Exhort his Brethren unto in the 5th Chapter?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That above all things, they ſhould not Swear at all, James 5. 12.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Unto whom did Peter write?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto the Strangers who dwelt through Pontus, Galatia, Capadocia, Aſia and Bythinia, 1 Pet. 1. 1.

p.hi: What did he Exhort them unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
To gird up the Loins of their
Minds, and be Sober, truſting Perfectly on the Grace of God, that as he, who had called them is holy, that they ſhould be Holy in all manner of Converſation, 1 Pet. 1. 13, 14, 15.

p.hi: What did he Exhort Women to?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That their adorning ſhould not be outward, as with Broidered Hair, Gold, or Pearl, &c. 1 Pet. 3. 3.

p.hi: How were they to be adorned?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: With a quiet and meek Spirit, after the manner of the Holy Women of God, 1 Pet. 3, 4, 5.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Saving Baptiſm which Peter ſpake of?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Not the putting away of the Filth of the Fleſh, but the anſwer of a good Conſcience, by the Reſurrection of Jeſus, 1 Pet. 3. 20, 21.

p.hi: What did he Exhort Paſtors unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Feed the Flock of Chriſt, not by Conſtraint, but willingly; not for filthy Lucre, but of a ready mind, 1 Peter 5. 2.

p.hi: What did he further Exhort the Saints unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To be ſober, and watch; for the Enemy, as a Roaring Lyon, walketh about ſeeking whom he may devour, 1 Peter 5. 8.
2ly, To make their Calling and Election ſure?

3ly, That they had a more ſure word of Propheſie, then that voice which was heard in the Mount, unto which he Exhorted them to take heed unto, untill the day dawned, and the Day-Star aroſe in their hearts, 2 Pet. 1. 19.

p.hi: What was this more ſure word of Propheſie?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Light wherewith Chriſt had enlightened them, verſ. 19.

p.hi: What did he warn the Saints of?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Of falſe Prophets, who through Covetouſneſs, with feigned words, would make merchandize of them, 2 Pet 2. 1.

p.hi: What further Marks had the falſe Prophets?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They had Eyes full of Adultery, that could not ceaſe from ſin, and Hearts exerciſed with Covetous Practices, &c. 2 Pet. 2. 14.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was John's Teſtimony of God?

sp.speaker: M,
sp.p: That he was Light, and in him was no Darkneſs at all; and if they walked in rhe Light, as he was in the Light, they had Fellowſhip one with another, and the Blood of Chriſt cleanſed them from all Sin, 1 John 1. 6, 7.

p.hi: How was the Love of God perfected in them?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In keeping of the Commandments of God, 1 John 2. 5.

p.hi: How was the Lying ſpirit manifeſted?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In pretending Love to God, and Knowledge of Him, and yet kept not his Commandments, verſ. 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did John tell the little Children?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
That it was the Laſt Time, and that they had heard that Antichriſt
ſhould come, and that even already there were many Antichriſts, verſ. 19.

p.hi: Where had they heard that Antichriſt ſhould come?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Chriſt had fore-told it, Mat. 7. & 24. cap.

p.hi: What was his further Exhortations?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That no man might deceive them; for none was Righteous, but him that did Righteouſneſs; for he that committed Sin was of the Devil: and again, whoſoever ſinneth, hath not ſeen him, neither known him, 1 John 3. 6, 7, 8.
2ly. In this was the Children of God manifeſted, and the Children of the Devil, verſ. 10.

p.hi: What did John ſay of them that did believe?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That they had the Witneſs in themſelves, 1 Joh. 3. 10.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did Jude exhort the Saints unto?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Earneſtly to contend for the Faith delivered them, Jude 1. 3.
2ly, To beware of Falſe Prophets, who walk'd after their own Luſts, v. 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who wrote the Revelation?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: John the Divine, Rev. 1. 1.

p.hi: Unto whom did he write?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Unto the Seven Churches of Aſia, verſ. 4.

p.hi: Whom did he ſee as Head and Chief of the Seven Churches?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Chriſt the Son of God deſcended from Heaven, ver, 13.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Unto what did he exhort the Church of Epheſus?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To Repent, and do her firſt Work, having (after much Suffering) forſaken her firſt Love, Rev. 2. 4, 5, 6.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did he write to the Church at Smyrna?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Not to fear thoſe things that ſhould come upon them; telling them, the Devil ſhould caſt ſome of them into Priſon, and they ſhould be
Perſecuted Ten Dayes: but be tho • Faithful unto Death, and I will giv • thee a Crown of Life, ver. 10.

p.hi: What did Chriſt promiſe to him tha • overcame?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To give him of the hidden Manna, and a White Stone, and in it a New Name written, which none knew but he that had it, ver. 17.

p.hi: What did he further Promiſe to him that overcame?

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: That he ſhould be clothed in White, and his Name ſhould not be blotted out of the Book of Life, Rev. 3. 5.
• ly, That he would make him a Pillar in the Temple of God, and he ſhall go no more out; and he would write upon him the Name of God, and the Name of the City of my God, v. 12.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What did he write to the Church of Laodicea?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
That ſhe was neither Hot nor Cold, and therefore the Lord would
ſpue her out of his Mouth, ver. 15, 16.

p.hi: What was the Token of Chriſt's Love to his People?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: That he Rebukes and Chaſtens them, verſ. 19.

p.hi: What did Chriſt further promiſe to him that Overcometh?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: He would grant him to ſit with him in his Throne, even as he over-came, and ſate with his Father in his Throne, verſ. 21.

p.hi: Who ſate on the Throne (that was ſet in Heaven) at the Right-hand of the Majeſty of God?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Lamb, Rev. 4. 2.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was the Sealed Book which none in Heaven nor Earth was worthy to open, but the Lyon of the Tribe of Judah?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Book of God's Judgments and Righteouſneſs, Rev. 5, 6, cap.

p.hi: What was the Woman that appeared in Heaven clothed with the Sun?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The true Spouſe, the Lamb's Wife, or True Church, Rev. 12. 1, 2.

p.hi: Who appeared againſt her, to deſtroy the Man-Child, with whom ſhe travelled?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: A Great Red Dragon, verſ. 3.

p.hi: Whither did the Woman flee to ſave her ſelf?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Into the Wilderneſs, where ſhe had a Place prepared of God, verſ. 6.

p.hi: Who were they who worſhipped the Beaſt?

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: They whoſe Names were not written in the Lamb's Book of Life, Rev. 13. 8.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Who ſtood with the Lamb upon Mount Zion?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: An Hundred Forty and Four Thouſand, having their Father's Name written in their Fore-Heads, Rev. 14. 1.

p.hi: What was purpoſed by the Harveſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The cutting down of the Vines of the Earth, and the caſting of them into the Wine-Preſs of the Wrath of God, verſ. 19.

p.hi: What was ſignified by the Woman arrayed
in Purple and Scarlet, and gilded with Gold, who had a Golden Cup in her hand full of Abomination?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Falſe Church, or Myſtery Babylon, the Mother of Whoredoms, who was drunk with the Blood of the Saints and Martyrs of Jeſus, Rev. 17. 4, 5, 6.

p.hi: What was the Waters on which the Whore ſate?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They are Peoples, and Multitudes, and Nations, and Tongues, v. 15.

p.hi: What was the Ten Horns?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Thoſe that ſhould hate the Whore and make her deſolate, and burn her Fleſh with Fire, verſ. 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: What was God's Decree concerning the Whore of Babylon?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Her total Overthrow and Deſtruction, with all her Merchants and Lovers, Rev. 18. cap.

p.hi: What was rendered unto God for his • uſtice upon the Great Whore?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Praiſes and Hallelujah from his Saints in Heaven. Rev. 19. 1, 2.

p.hi: What was the Lamb's Name who ſate upon the White Horſe?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Word of God, verſ. 16.

p.hi: What was the Portion of the Beaſt and the Falſe Prophet, which had wrought Miracles before him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They both were caſt alive into the Lake of Fire, burning with Brimſtone, verſ. 20.

p.hi: Whither was the Dragon the Old Serpent caſt?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Into the bottomleſs Pit, in which he was ſhut, and the Door ſeal'd upon him, that he might deceive the People no more, till a thouſand years was expir'd, Rev. 20. 3, 4.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: To what was the Heavenly Jeruſalem likened?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To a Bride adorned for her Huſband.

sp.speaker: S
sp.p:
What was the Compaſs of the Heavenly
Jeruſalem, whoſe Length, Breadth and Heighth are equal?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Twelve thouſand Furlongs, Rev. 21. 16.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: Did John ſee an outward Temple in the Heavenly City?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; for the Lord God and the Lamb was the Temple of it, verſ. 22.

p.hi: Had the City any need of the Sun, Moon or Candle?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: No; for the Glory of God did light it, and the Lamb was the Light thereof; and the People who were ſaved, walked in the Light thereof, verſ. 24.

sp.speaker: S.
sp.p: VVhat did the Angel further ſhew unto John?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: A pure River of Water of Life, clear as Cryſtal, proceeding out of the Throne of God, Rev. 22. 1.

p.hi: VVhat more did he ſhew him?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Tree of Life, which bare twelve manner of Fruits, verſ. 2.

p.hi: VVho had Right to the Tree of Life and to enter into the City?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: They who did the Commandments of the Lamb.

p.hi: VVho were ſhut out of the City?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: The Dogs, Whoremongers, and Murderers, and Idolaters, and whoſoever loveth and maketh Lyes, verſ. 15.

p.hi: VVho did the Lamb invite to come and Drink of the VVater of Life?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Whoſoever was a Thirſt, verſ. 17.

p.hi: VVhat was the Lot of him who added or diminiſhed to or from the Prophecy of the Book?

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: God would add to him (who added) all the Plagues written in th • Book.
And he that diminiſheth, God wou •• take his Part out of the Book of Life, and out of the Holy City, verſ. 18, ••
